description.narrative: The purpose of this particular development engagement is to provide a bridging grant to IWGIA for 2020. The bridging grant will allow the MFA to prepare for an organisational strategy with a programmatic contribution that is aligned with IWGIA’s next strategic cycle 2021 – 2024.

This grant supports the International Work Group for Indigenous Affairs with the overall objective “to endorse and promote indigenous peoples’ right to self-determination, their cultural integrity and their right to development on their own conditions”.
This will be achieved through: Direct support to indigenous peoples and organizations with a view to improving their social, cultural and political circumstances, including projects implemented by or with indigenous organizations and communities. Facilitating and supporting indigenous peoples’ involvement in International processes related to human rights and other issues relevant for them. Investigating, documenting and disseminating information about indigenous peoples’ present circumstances. Advocacy and lobbying work in support of indigenous peoples’ rights with the purpose of influencing decision makers in political and economic institutions on the national and international level
The partner’s results description and results frameworks are global, general, and highly aggregated and the MFA core contribution is thus reflected in the overall results reporting by the partner. Please refer to the hyperlink below
